meanings.definition: The quality or state of being changeable or variable.
meanings.sent1: Her life was full of changefulness, with unexpected twists and turns.
meanings.sent2: The weather's changefulness made it difficult to plan outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: The cat's changefulness in choosing a favorite spot to nap always kept the family entertained.
meanings.sent4: Like the seasons, his mood shifted with the changefulness of the wind.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of changefulness in her ever-evolving masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The tendency to change or fluctuate frequently.
meanings.sent1: The stock market's changefulness kept investors on their toes.
meanings.sent2: The river's changefulness was evident in its constantly shifting course.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's changefulness in food preferences made mealtime an adventure.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, trends come and go with the same changefulness as the wind.
meanings.sent5: The political landscape showed its true changefulness during the election season.
